meanings.definition: To make a dirty mark or smear on (a surface)
meanings.sent1: She accidentally smudged the painting with her fingers.
meanings.sent2: The child smudged the window with his greasy hands.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy smudged paw prints all over the freshly mopped floor.
meanings.sent4: His tears smudged the ink on the letter, making it difficult to read.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hand smudged the charcoal, creating a beautiful shadow effect.

meanings.definition: A blurred or smeared mark on a surface
meanings.sent1: There was a smudged fingerprint on the mirror.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph had a smudged corner from being handled too much.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a smudged clue that led to the identity of the thief.
meanings.sent4: The smudged writing on the whiteboard was barely legible.
meanings.sent5: The smudged lipstick stain on the collar hinted at a secret rendezvous.
